intro: Ceropegia mayottae, commonly known as the Mayotte milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in groups. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Ceropegia mayottae is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endemic species.
